Miscellaneous Highlights: The Chicago White Sox lost 4-3 in 13 innings to the Los Angeles Angels on September 18, dropping their record to 36-117.
Others: The team tied the American League record with 21 consecutive losses this summer.
The White Sox may soon hit an all-time low with a potential record of 120 losses in a single season, which would be the most losses by a team in the modern era since 1900.
